<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
bash prepare-iwslt17-multilingual.sh fails with errors. <denchmark-code>FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: './iwslt17.de_fr.en.bpe16k/valid.fr-en.fr' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>cd examples/translation bash prepare-iwslt17-multilingual.sh </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
Did not change fairseq code <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
The script should succeed without error <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version (e.g., 1.0 or master): master (commit cb2dc41) PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 1.4.0 OS (e.g., Linux): Ubuntu 18.04 How you installed fairseq (pip, source): source Build command you used (if compiling from source): pip install --editable . Python version: 3.7.5 CUDA/cuDNN version: 10.1 GPU models and configuration: NVIDIA K80 Any other relevant information:
<denchmark-h:h3>Additional context</denchmark-h>
The script produces files named such as , , ..., however later the script expects without an index number. The change is by the commit <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/commit/1da061f37f444e492f9cd9c7d058e35dcbf4d2c3>1da061f</denchmark-link> .

comments.comment: The script succeeds with the following change. diff --git a/examples/translation/prepare-iwslt17-multilingual.sh b/examples/translation/prepare-iwslt17-multilingual.sh index ce28481..d21e2bb 100644 --- a/examples/translation/prepare-iwslt17-multilingual.sh +++ b/examples/translation/prepare-iwslt17-multilingual.sh @@ -86,6 +86,8 @@ echo "pre-processing valid data..." for ((i=0;i<${#SRCS[@]};++i)); do SRC=${SRCS[i]} VALID_SET=(${VALID_SETS[i]}) + rm -f "$DATA/valid.${SRC}-${TGT}.${SRC}" + rm -f "$DATA/valid.${SRC}-${TGT}.${TGT}" for ((j=0;j<${#VALID_SET[@]};++j)); do FILE=${VALID_SET[j]} for LANG in "$SRC" "$TGT"; do @@ -93,7 +95,7 @@ for ((i=0;i<${#SRCS[@]};++i)); do | sed -e 's/<seg id="[0-9]*">\s*//g' \ | sed -e 's/\s*<\/seg>\s*//g' \ | sed -e "s/\‚Äô/\'/g" \ - > "$DATA/valid${j}.${SRC}-${TGT}.${LANG}" + >> "$DATA/valid.${SRC}-${TGT}.${LANG}" done done

Do you mind submitting a PR with a fix? I think the idea is to produce separate validation sets rather than combining them all into one. So probably these lines need to change to loop over each validation set:
fairseq/examples/translation/prepare-iwslt17-multilingual.sh
Lines 124 to 125 in adb5b9c
--inputs $DATA/valid.${SRC}-${TGT}.${SRC} $DATA/valid.${SRC}-${TGT}.${TGT} \
--outputs $DATA/valid.bpe.${SRC}-${TGT}.${SRC} $DATA/valid.bpe.${SRC}-${TGT}.${TGT}

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/myleott>@myleott</denchmark-link> Thanks. I updated the script to loop over the valid files. As we have multiple valid files, we need to run like below. I can also update , but I want to make sure this is what you think it should be. <denchmark-code>fairseq-preprocess --source-lang de --target-lang en \ --trainpref $TEXT/train.bpe.de-en \ --validpref $TEXT/valid0.bpe.de-en,$TEXT/valid1.bpe.de-en,$TEXT/valid2.bpe.de-en,$TEXT/valid3.bpe.de-en,$TEXT/valid4.bpe.de-en,$TEXT/valid5.bpe.de-en \ --joined-dictionary \ --destdir data-bin/iwslt17.de_fr.en.bpe16k \ --workers 10 </denchmark-code>
Yes that looks perfect, I'll merge your PR and update the README as well, thank you!
